clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing 2L Bi-Pegyte to 4L PegLyte Regiments for Outpatient Colonic Preparation
clinical_study.official_title: Oral 2L Bi-PegLyte Versus 4L PegLyte Regimen for Outpatient Colonic Preparation: A Randomized, Non-Inferiority Open Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators wish to compare the efficacy and patient tolerability of a preparation consisting of 2L Bi-Peglyte plus 15mg of bisacodyl vs the standard preparation of 4L Peglyte. The investigators hypothesize that 2L Bi-Peglyte with 15mg bisacodyl will show higher efficacy and tolerability.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Boston Bowel Preparation Scale between the two groups
primary_outcome.description: This is an established rating scale to evaluate the quality of bowel prep. The ratings will be compared between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the number of participants who develop distress symptoms from bowel prep (and the type) between the two groups
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who develop distress symptoms from bowel prep, and the type of distress symptoms will be compared between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the absolute number/percentage of participants in the two groups who find the bowel prep experience easy, acceptable, difficult, very difficult, or unable to complete.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate their bowel prep experience (based on ease of use) on a Likert scale. The number of participants in each level will subsequently be quantified (n, %) and compared between the two groups.

clinical_study.condition: Ease of Bowel Preparation and Patient Tolerability

arm_group.description: Subject will receive standard bowel prep prior to colonoscopy.
Subjects will be asked to take 2L Bi-Peglyte + 15mg bisacodyl for bowel prep the day before colonoscopy.

intervention.description: Subjects will be asked to take 4L of Peglyte the day prior to procedure.
Subjects will be asked to take 2L Bi-Peglyte and 15mg bisacodyl the day prior to procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 19 or older
- Outpatient colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- constipation
